revised_title: Discovery of a Portion of the Lower Jaw of the Iguanodon and Osteological Analysis of Saurians in Tilgate Forest
tldr: The author discovers a portion of the lower jaw of a young Iguanodon, providing insights into the osteology of the dinosaur and its relation to other Saurians found in Tilgate Forest, Sussex. The fossil reveals similarities to the Iguana, but the unique form of the teeth indicates a distinct masticatory apparatus in the Iguanodon, different from any living reptile.
